Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Rep. Trey Gowdy has been given the "highest level of security clearance possible" through an executive order from the President himself.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks support as there is no evidence or documentation of President Trump signing an executive order granting Rep. Gowdy the highest level of security clearance.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Rep. Gowdy has been granted a high level of security clearance based on the false information circulating online.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that members of Congress already have access to classified intelligence reports by virtue of their elected positions, and Rep. Gowdy is also a member of the House intelligence committee.
